alert.note: Alert for Cleveland (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 13 at 11:38PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 AM EDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of western North Carolina, including eastern Rutherford and southwestern Cleveland Counties. * WHEN...Until 530 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1133 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding, particularly in areas near Ellenboro, NC. Areas near Edley Toney Road, Mooresboro Road, New House Road, Hollis Road, and McKinney Mill Road may see localized flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Shelby, Forest City, Spindale, Boiling Springs NC, Ellenboro, Lattimore, Mooresboro, Bostic, Alexander Mills, Caroleen, Henrietta, Cliffside and Sunshine. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
